text: Hey, this is John at the Bible Project. Last week on the podcast, we began a conversation about the identity of God in the Bible. And we quickly ran into a problem.

In Hebrew, the word translated as God means is the word Elohim.
Elohim is a word that refers to a type of being, a spiritual being, and it can refer to spiritual beings of all kinds.

And that's the big takeaway from last week. Elohim, translated in your Bible as God doesn't strictly mean the all powerful creator God. It actually refers to a wide swath of spiritual beings. Lowercase g, gods. These beings exist, they have power, and. And they're referred to in Scripture.
